final_answer:
The humor in the image lies in the juxtaposition of the caption "YES, BUT" with the scene of a person at a buffet. The person has an overfilled plate with a wide variety of food, highlighting typical behavior at buffets where people tend to take more than they can reasonably eat. 

The satirical element comes from the exaggerated abundance on the plate, contrasting with the simplicity of just needing a fork and napkin to handle such an overwhelming amount. The caption "YES, BUT" suggests a common excuse or justification people might give when overindulging, adding a layer of irony and humor to the situation.
